text: __NOTOC__ This is a list of players who graduated from the Challenge Tour in 2014. The top 15 players on the Challenge Tour's money list in 2014 earned their European Tour card for 2015. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center" ! !!colspan=2|2014 Challenge Tour!!colspan=6|2015 European Tour |- !Player!!Money list rank!!Earnings (€)!!Starts!!Cuts made!!Best finish!!Money list rank!!Earnings (€) |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=left| Andrew Johnston || 1 || 190,856 || 25 || 14 || || || 480,173 |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=left| Benjamin Hébert || 2 || 178,266 || 30 || 19 || || || 585,427 |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=left| An Byeong-hun* || 3 || 150,107 || 26 || 20 || || || 2,417,356 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Moritz Lampert || 4 || 137,194 || 29 || 9 || 10 || || 115,581 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Mark Tullo || 5 || 129,968 || 28 || 8 || || || 77,642 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Sam Hutsby || 6 || 128,984 || 31 || 8 || || || 60,443 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Jordi García Pinto* || 7 || 112,317 || 28 || 10 || || || 86,586 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Jason Palmer* || 8 || 108,056 || 19 || 8 || || || 59,496 |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=left| Mike Lorenzo- Vera || 9 || 106,796 || 24 || 16 || || || 426,269 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Oliver Farr* || 10 || 101,476 || 30 || 10 || || || 107,771 |-style="background:#D0F0C0;" |align=left| Édouard España* || 11 || 95,012 || 27 || 14 || || || 296,256 |-style="background:#FFF080;" |align=left| Florian Fritsch || 12 || 92,943 || 18 || 10 || || || 206,346 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Jérôme Lando-Casanova* || 13 || 88,785 || 31 || 8 || || || 87,556 |-style="background:#FFF080;" |align=left| Jake Roos* || 14 || 87,431 || 28 || 12 || || || 138,929 |-style="background:#F08080;" |align=left| Jason Barnes* || 15 || 77,793 || 27 || 9 || || || 78,218 |} * European Tour rookie in 2015 T = Tied The player retained his European Tour card for 2016 (finished inside the top 110). The player did not retain his European Tour card for 2016, but retained conditional status (finished between 111–149). The player did not retain his European Tour card for 2016 (finished outside the top 149). Lampert earned a direct promotion to the European Tour after his third win of the season in August, while Hébert earned his third win at the season-ending Challenge Tour Grand Final. ==Winners on the European Tour in 2015== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No. !Date !Player !Tournament !Winning score !Margin of victory !Runner-up |- |align=center|1 |24 May | An Byeong-hun |BMW PGA Championship |−21 (71-64-67-65=267) |6 strokes | Thongchai Jaidee, Miguel Ángel Jiménez |} ==Runners-up on the European Tour in 2015== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No.!!Date!!Player!!Tournament!!Winner!!Winning score!!Runner-up score |- |align=center|1 |17 May | Édouard España |Open de España | James Morrison |−10 (70-71-68-69=278) |−6 (68-69-76-69=282) |} ==See also== *2014 European Tour Qualifying School graduates == External links == *Final ranking for 2014 Category:Challenge Tour Category:European Tour Challenge Tour Graduates Challenge Tour Graduates
title: 2014 Challenge Tour graduates
